channel.title: IRC - Quite possibly the worst run network, ever
channel.description: Why is there even multiple servers? It's not like you need to load balance for a whole 40 clients. I get more netsplit spam logged from this network than about ten others combined.

The bottom line is the network sucks, thanks.

item.source: IRC - Quite possibly the worst run network, ever

item.title: IRC - Quite possibly the worst run network, ever
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Elijah:

Kernel Panic? Isn’t that like a general hardware/software issue or something. I know macs have it, and that’s what it is.

Many things can cause a kernel panic, and all OS’s have them, with windows this is the beloved BSOD.

We are trying to figure out what causes these random netsplits for no reason, but it’s hard to track down. Connectivity between servers is fine, the software isn’t crashing, it is just disconnecting. There is no reason for it.

Read full topic
item.source: IRC - Quite possibly the worst run network, ever

item.source: IRC - Quite possibly the worst run network, ever

item.title: IRC - Quite possibly the worst run network, ever
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I was able to connect to mitb.moparisthebest.com fine after the split, so I’m guessing it was the hub. Also:

Moparisthebest:

I don’t know if the hub actually went down or not, my server went down due to something like “kernel panic: out of memory and cannot end any processes”. I don’t know how the hell that happened, as the machine has 6GB of RAM and the same amount of swap space. I ran memtest and it passed without any errors, so hopefully it doesn’t happen again…

tl;dr “i don’t know what happened let’s hope it stops somehow”

Read full topic
